meanings.definition: To have power over something or someone
meanings.sent1: She can control the TV with the remote.
meanings.sent2: The teacher needs to control the noisy classroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat thinks it can control the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: His anger began to control his actions.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to control the cards effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: He can control the traffic flow with hand signals.
meanings.sent2: The coach must control the team during the game.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to control the unruly pot of boiling water.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor helped her control the situation.
meanings.sent5: The conductor skillfully controlled the tempo of the music.

meanings.sent1: Eating healthy helps control your weight.
meanings.sent2: Parents need to control their children's screen time.
meanings.sent3: The gate is there to control the flow of people.
meanings.sent4: He struggled to control his laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent5: The thermostat helps control the temperature in the house.

meanings.definition: A device used to operate or regulate a machine or system
meanings.sent1: The remote control changes the TV channels.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to keep the control panel clean.
meanings.sent3: The video game controller is his favorite control.
meanings.sent4: The steering wheel is an essential control in a car.
meanings.sent5: The scientist adjusted the control to test the experiment.
